paramInformation.label: Send Basic Report on State Change
Setting Minimum Brightness Value
paramInformation.description: The bigger the value is, the higher the load’s minimum brightness is

paramInformation.label: Wiring Type
paramInformation.description: Wiring type  note: this parameter is read only

paramInformation.label: Load Type
paramInformation.description: Load type  note: this parameter is read only

paramInformation.label: Over Current Protection
paramInformation.description: Triggered at over 2.1A for 20 seconds continuously.

paramInformation.label: Power Automatic Report Absolute Threshold, Unit is W
paramInformation.description: When power changes above the absolute threshold, immediately report current power value

paramInformation.label: Power Automatic Report Percentage Threshold, Unit is %
paramInformation.description: When power changes above the percentage threshold, immediately report current power value

paramInformation.label: Power Metering Automatic Report Time Cycle, Unit is Second
paramInformation.description: Power metering automatic report time cycle, unit is second

paramInformation.label: Energy Metering Automatic Report Time Cycle, Unit is Second
paramInformation.description: Energy metering automatic report time cycle, unit is second

paramInformation.label: Voltage Metering Automatic Report Time Cycle, Unit is Second
paramInformation.description: Voltage metering automatic report time cycle, unit is second

paramInformation.label: Current Metering Automatic Report Time Cycle, Unit is Second
paramInformation.description: Current metering automatic report time cycle, unit is second

paramInformation.label: Startup Brightness
paramInformation.description: When the light is turned from off to on, if the target brightness is lower than the startup brightness, the brightness will first go to the startup brightness then fall to the target brightness.

paramInformation.label: Enable/Disable to Detect Load After Re-power On
paramInformation.description: Enable/disable to detect load after re-power on (detect load type, minimum brightness, maximum brightness)  note: when the device does not belong to any network, load detection will be enabled every time after re-power on. when the device has already been added to a network, load detection will be disabled

options.label: Enable to detect every time after re-power on
Enable to detect only after first re-power on

metadata.inclusion:
1. Set primary controller/gateway into inclusion mode (Please refer to your primary controller’s manual on how to turn your controller into inclusion).
2. Power on the in-wall dimmer and set it into inclusion mode. There are two methods to set the in-wall dimmer into inclusion mode:
1)Repower on the dimmer, it will be set into inclusion mode automatically, and waiting to be included.
2)Triple press the action button on the dimmer, it will set the dimmer into inclusion mode.
The connected light will stay solid on for 3 seconds to indicate successful inclusion
metadata.exclusion:
There are two exclusion methods:
Method 1: Exclusion from the primary controller/gateway as follows:
1. Set the primary controller/gateway into exclusion mode (Please refer to your primary controllers manual on how to set your controller into exclusion).
2. Triple press the action button, the dimmer will be set to exclusion mode, and waiting to be excluded, then the dimmer will be excluded from the network.
Method 2: Factory reset the dimmer will force it to be excluded from a network. (please refer to the part “Factory Reset” of this manual)
Note: Factory reset is not recommended for exclusion, please use this procedure only if the primary controller/gateway is missing or otherwise inoperable
metadata.reset:
Press and hold down the action button for over 10 seconds, the dimmer will be reset to factory defaults.

Note: Factory reset is not recommended for exclusion, please use this procedure only if the primary controller/gateway is missing or otherwise inoperable
